history.content:
Hello- sorry for the delay. There is nothing in the Physics 89 course description that indicates that no credit is offered after completion of Math 54. You may wish to contact the physics department, but here is the description:

PHYSICS 89 Introduction to Mathematical Physics 4 Units

Terms offered: 2016 Summer, 2016 Spring, 2015 Fall
Complex numbers, linear algebra, ordinary differential equations, Fourier series and transform methods, introduction to partial differential equations, introduction to tensors. Applications to physics will be emphasized. This course or an equivalent course required for physics major. 

Rules & Requirements

Prerequisites: MATH 53

Hours & Format

Fall and/or spring: 15 weeks - 3 hours of lecture and 2 hours of discussion per week

Summer: 10 weeks - 4 hours of lecture and 3 hours of discussion per week

Additional Details

Subject/Course Level: Physics/Undergraduate

Grading/Final exam status: Letter grade. Final exam required.

just wanted to confirm that eecs majors can get credit for physics 89, having already taken math 54?

i heard that physics majors can use either physics 89 or math 54 to satisfy a requirement, but 54 (obviously) doesn't go over all the physics applications, complex numbers, fourier, tensors, etc. that physics 89 includes.
history.subject: credit for physics 89
